result.execSummary:
The defendant Shannon M. Parker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shannon M. Parker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shannon M. Parker was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Shannon M. Parker in court with attorney Jane Krueger Smith.  Defendant Shannon M. Parker in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI report received and reviewed by counsel.  Discussion regarding additional 73 pages of discovery given to defense this morning.  Response by Atty. Parker.  Objection by Atty. Krueger Smith.  Court will now allow any reference to the pages - defense chooses to proceed today.  Both sides mention minor errors in PSI.  Remarks by counsels regarding sentence.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court pronounces sentence.  Credit for time served since June 4, 2014.  Appeal rights given.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty. Dismiss Count 2.  Voting and firearms restrictions noted.  PSI requested and ordered.  Defense may want an alternate PSI prepared.
Copy of e-mail correspondence
Given in court.
This case will be tracking the case 13CF37, this case maybe will set for jury trial during the week of October 6, 2014.
